thread.title: Calipari celebrates big road win with east coast recruiting trip
thread.title_full: Calipari celebrates big road win with east coast recruiting trip

title: Calipari celebrates big road win with east coast recruiting trip
text:
Manage Calipari celebrates big road win with east coast recruiting trip Kentucky coach John Calipari will celebrate his team's big road win at Alabama with an east coast recruiting trip Sunday. 
How is Kentucky coach John Calipari celebrating his Wildcats' big 67-58 road win at Alabama? 
With an east coast recruiting trip, of course. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
Calipari, along with assistant Tony Barbee , will see Kentucky signee Nick Richards along with a handful of the nation's top underclassmen at the Primetime Shootout at Roselle (N.J.) Catholic Sunday. 
– Calipari and Barbee will watch 5-star teammates Moses Brown and Cole Anthony go head-to-head with Richards' Patrick School (N.J.) squad. 
Brown (7-0, 210) is ranked as the top center and No. 8 overall prospect in the 2018 class by the industry-average 247Sports Composite while Anthony (6-1, 175) is ranked the No. 1 point guard and 12th overall in the 2019 class. 
Brown holds early offers from the likes of Maryland, Florida and Kansas among others while Kansas, Georgetown, St. John's and Iona have already offered Anthony. 
– Along with Georgetown and Rutgers, the Kentucky staff will also see Eatontown (N.J.) Ranney School 5-star guards Bryan Antoine and Scottie Lewis play Newark East Side. 
Antoine (6-4, 175) and Lewis (6-5, 177), who have been on UK's radar for sometime, are ranked Nos. 5 and 6, respectively, in the 2019 class by 247Sports . 
Florida, Villanova, Seton Hall, St. John's and Rutgers are among the schools most heavily involved in the early going.
